metadata.title: CVE-2016-6321 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the safer_name_suffix function in GNUtar 1.14 through 1.29 might allow remote attackers to bypass an intendedprotection mechanism and write to arbitrary files via vectors related toimproper sanitization of the file_name parameter, aka POINTYFEATHER.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6321` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tar - 1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1
tar-scripts - 1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tar package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.28-2.1ubuntu0.1').
